alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Idaho Palouse; Lewiston Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 1:47PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Latah, northwestern Nez Perce, western Benewah, northeastern Garfield, eastern Whitman and southeastern Spokane Counties through 115 PM PDT... At 1247 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles west of Plummer to 14 miles northwest of Potlatch to 7 miles southeast of Pomeroy. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pullman, Moscow, Colfax, Plummer, Potlatch, Parkline, Palouse, Tekoa, Garfield, Albion, Rosalia, Oakesdale, Colton, Uniontown, Onaway, Latah, Farmington, Tensed, Steptoe, and Belmont. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 332 and 394. U.S. Highway 12 in Washington between mile markers 407 and 417. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 5 and 66. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Idaho Palouse; Lewiston Area
